title: Simulation workflow
text: document illustrates simulation workflow ERAHUMED. Specifically, cover: setup run simulation. extract analyze simulation results. guide addressed users working command-line (.e. R) interface erahumed.
code: library(erahumed)

title: Simulation workflow
text: Running ERAHUMED simulation involves several layers computation, formalize concept simulation layers. Concretely, simulations composed following layers: INP: INPut data. HBA: Hydrological Balance Albufera lake. HBP: Hydrological Balance rice Paddy clusters. CA: Chemical Applications. CT: Chemical Transport. layer depends previous ones dependency subsequent ones (order ). goal following sections teach operate simulations layers erahumed.

title: Simulation workflow
text: can create new simulation : object s , behind scenes, R list contains simulation layers. list ERAHUMED layers can obtained : can extract individual layers follows: revealed outputs , layers simulation yet computed stage. result erahumed_simulation() initialize simulation, using default values parameters required various simulation layers. show following setup individual layers, run simulation extract results.
code: s <- erahumed_simulation() s #> An ERAHUMED simulation. #> Computed layers: None erahumed_layers() #> [1] "inp" "hba" "hbp" "ca"  "ct" get_layer(s, "hba")  # Extract the HBA layer #> A ERAHUMED HBA simulation layer. #>  #> Output columns:

title: Simulation workflow
text: Setup individual layers achieved family setup_*() functions, receive simulation input, return simulation updated setup. instance, configure height threshold parameter used HBP layer computations (see ?setup_hbp), use: Similarly, limit date range simulation, can provide filteredoutflows_df data-set INP layer: available parameters layer arguments corresponding setup_*() function, default values set erahumed_simulation() correspond defaults setup_*() arguments. current layer parameters simulation can obtained :
code: s <- setup_hbp(s, height_thresh_cm = 1) outflows_df <- albufera_outflows |>   (\(.) .["2020-01-01" <= .$date & .$date <= "2020-12-31", ])() s <- setup_inp(s, outflows_df = outflows_df) get_layer_parameters(s, "ct")  # Get parameters of CT layer #> $drift #> [1] 0 #>  #> $covmax #> [1] 0.5 #>  #> $jgrow #> [1] 152 #>  #> $SNK #> [1] 0 #>  #> $dact_m #> [1] 0.1 #>  #> $css_ppm #> [1] 50 #>  #> $foc #> [1] 0.17 #>  #> $bd_g_cm3 #> [1] 1.5 #>  #> $qseep_m_day #> [1] 0 #>  #> $wilting #> [1] 0.24 #>  #> $fc #> [1] 0.35

title: Simulation workflow
text: ready simulation setup, can compute various layers, using run_simulation() function. order speed iterations,erahumed gives option compute just specific layer upstream dependencies. example: compute INP, HBA HBP layers. simply want compute layers, can just call: (notice recompute INP, HBA HBP layers, since results already stored input simulation object).
code: s <- run_simulation(s, layer = "hbp") s #> An ERAHUMED simulation. #> Computed layers: inp, hba, hbp s <- run_simulation(s) s #> An ERAHUMED simulation. #> Computed layers: inp, hba, hbp, ca, ct

title: Simulation workflow
text: setup ran simulation, want analyse result, essentially time-series data-sets (possibly spatial component identified cluster_id). can extract output (data.frame) given layer follows: , analysis may proceed way find convenient. instance, chunk create plot water levels set clusters similar features, using dplyr ggplot2:

title: ERAHUMED Data Analysis and Visualization
text: can install latest release erahumed Github, running following command local R session: want development version (notice: may unstable), simply omit @*release reference, :
code: remotes::install_github("erahumed/erahumed@*release") remotes::install_github("erahumed/erahumed")  # development version

title: ERAHUMED Data Analysis and Visualization
text: graphical interface ERAHUMED DSS can accessed following R command: open DSS dashboard default browser, can explore simulation outputs user friendly manner.
code: erahumed::launch_app()

what: Example 2: command line interface to simulations
title: ERAHUMED Data Analysis and Visualization
text: following example illustrates workflow manually running ERAHUMED simulation chain, extracting outputs various simulation layers. information, see main package vignette. pipeline always starts initializing ERAHUMED simulation, via: main abstraction erahumed uses collect various layers involved simulation chain DSS, namely: output shows, layers simulation initialized computed yet. can modify configuration specific layers setup_*() functions, instance: order actually compute layers, use run_simulation(): Simulations composed following layers (dependency order, upstream downstream): INP [setup_inp()]: INPut data. HBA [setup_hba()]: Hydrological Balance Albufera lake. HBP [setup_hbp()]: Hydrological Balance rice Paddy clusters. CA [setup_ca()]: Chemical Applications. CT [setup_ct()]: Chemical Transport. order inspect results given layer, use: information simulation interface, can consult ?erahumed_simulation_interface.
code: library(erahumed) simulation <- erahumed_simulation() simulation #> An ERAHUMED simulation. #> Computed layers: None erahumed_layers() #> [1] "inp" "hba" "hbp" "ca"  "ct" simulation <- simulation |>   setup_hbp(ideal_flow_rate_cm = 2.5) |>   setup_ct(dact_m = 0.2) simulation <- simulation |>   run_simulation(layer = "hba")  # Run simulation until the HBA layer get_layer(simulation, "hba") #> A ERAHUMED HBA simulation layer. #>  #> Output columns: level, precipitation_mm, evapotranspiration_mm, date, is_imputed_level, is_imputed_outflow, volume, volume_change, volume_change_petp, outflow_pujol, outflow_perellonet, outflow_perello, outflow_recirculation, outflow_total, inflow_total, residence_time_days get_layer_parameters(simulation, "hba") #> $storage_curve #> \(level) 16.7459 * 1e6 + level * 23.6577 * 1e6 #> <environment: 0x00000270bbb6e920> #>  #> $petp_function #> \(p, etp) 114.226 * 1e3 * p - 79.361 * 1e3 * etp #> <environment: 0x00000270bbb6e920> title: ERAHUMED simulation interface — erahumed_simulation_interface
text: programming interface {erahumed} package reflects sequential structure ERAHUMED simulation chain. step sequence referred across documentation simulation "layer". documentation page focuses describing set abstractions provided {erahumed} deal simulation layers. information, can consult main package vignette. first abstraction provided erahumed_simulation objects. objects, technically implemented S3 classes, simple containers simulation layers - , erahumed_simulation list stores simulation layers. turn, layers implemented S3 classes following naming scheme erahumed_*, inherit erahumed_simulation_layer, ad-hoc print plot methods. Creating new erahumed_simulation object setup, run, fresh new simulation default settings layers. layer associated setup_*() function allows modify layer-specific configurations. order run (.e compute actual results) simulation, one use run_simulation. define following layers, whose technical implementation discussed extensively linked documentation pages: inp: INPut data. hba: Hydrological Balance Albufera lake. hbp: Hydrological Balance rice Paddy clusters. ca: Chemical Applications. ct: Chemical Transport. order simulation layers list logical one. layer depends previous ones (referred "upstream"), dependency subsequent ones (referred "downstream"). list ERAHUMED layers can also obtained erahumed_layers helper. example code illustrates typical operations simulation layers.

title: HBA: Hydrological Balance of the Albufera Lake — hba
code: setup_hba(   simulation,   storage_curve = function(level) 16.7459 * 1e+06 + level * 23.6577 * 1e+06,   petp_function = function(p, etp) 114.226 * 1000 * p - 79.361 * 1000 * etp )

title: HBA: Hydrological Balance of the Albufera Lake — hba
text: simulation object class erahumed_simulation. storage_curve function takes numeric vector input, returns numeric vector length. Function converts lake levels lake volumes. petp_function function takes two numeric vectors common length inputs, returns numeric vector length. Function converts precipitation evapotranspiration values (assumed expressed millimiters) overall volume change ( cube meters inputs given expected units).

title: HBA: Hydrological Balance of the Albufera Lake — hba
text: objects class erahumed_simulation.

title: HBA: Hydrological Balance of the Albufera Lake — hba
text: numeric inputs linear storage curve taken CHJ report modelo de seguimiento de l’Albufera de Valencia con AQUATOOLDMA.. values used arguments petp_function() calculated package authors, correspond total study area (surface_P) flooded surface (surface_ETP). output data.frame calculated HBA layer contains copy input data, well following additional columns: volume Volume time series, obtained storage curve. volume_change Differenced time series volume. \(n\)-th given \(\Delta V _n \equiv V_{n+1}-V_n\), \(V_n\) volume time step \(n\). petp_change Time series. amount \(\Delta V _n ^\text{P-ETP}\) volume change due precipitation evapotranspiration, obtained P-ETP surface. outflow_total Time series total outflows, measured cube meters per second. sum \(\sum _i O_i\) time series passed outflows argument, plus extra term \(O_R\) estimates outflow due water recirculation (see TODO #60). outflow_recirculation Time series. Estimate outflow due water recirculation. inflow_total Time serie total inflows, cube meters per second. computed \(= \sum _{} O_i + \delta O + \frac{\Delta V _n - \Delta V _n ^\text{P-ETP}}{24 \times 60 \times 60}\). residence_time_days. Residence time, simulationed hba_residence_time.

title: Residence Time — hba_residence_time
text: N.B.:: function one used internally hba compute residence times, directly exported {erahumed}. Computes residence times \(t = \overline{\text{Volume}} / \overline{\text{Outflow}} \), \(\overline {\cdot}\) denotes (symmetric) moving average.

title: Residence Time — hba_residence_time
text: volume numeric vector. Time series volumes \(\text{m}^3\). outflow_total numeric vector. Time series total outflow \(\text{m}^3 / \text{s}\). k positive integer. Size window moving average. default order magnitude actual residence time Albufera Lake. units either "days" "seconds". Units measure returned time series.

title: Residence Time — hba_residence_time
text: numeric vector. Time series residence times, units measure specified units argument (assuming volume total_inflow provided correct units).

title: erahumed 0.9.0

Physico-chemical processes altogether treated exactly, solving corresponding linear ODE obtained removing terms corresponding outflow, chemical applications solubility (latter processes calculated second stage, masses obtained evolving time step according linear ODE system). Although still suboptimal POV outflow process considered instantaneous simultaneous application (see #146), already gives rise much realistic dynamics, especially relation diffusion process water sediment.
